command.name: fix
command.description: Propose a fix for the problems in the selected code

disambiguation.description: Propose a fix for the problems in the selected code
examples: There is a problem in this code. Rewrite the code to show it with the bug fixed.

parts.text:
Type '{ OR?: ({ name: { contains: string; mode: "insensitive"; }; } | { email: { contains: string; mode: "insensitive"; }; } | { phone: { contains: string; mode: "insensitive"; }; } | { role: { contains: string; mode: string; }; })[] | undefined; }' is not assignable to type 'UserWhereInput'.
  Types of property 'OR' are incompatible.
    Type '({ name: { contains: string; mode: "insensitive"; }; } | { email: { contains: string; mode: "insensitive"; }; } | { phone: { contains: string; mode: "insensitive"; }; } | { role: { contains: string; mode: string; }; })[] | undefined' is not assignable to type 'UserWhereInput[] | undefined'.
      Type '({ name: { contains: string; mode: "insensitive"; }; } | { email: { contains: string; mode: "insensitive"; }; } | { phone: { contains: string; mode: "insensitive"; }; } | { role: { contains: string; mode: string; }; })[]' is not assignable to type 'UserWhereInput[]'.
        Type '{ name: { contains: string; mode: "insensitive"; }; } | { email: { contains: string; mode: "insensitive"; }; } | { phone: { contains: string; mode: "insensitive"; }; } | { role: { contains: string; mode: string; }; }' is not assignable to type 'UserWhereInput'.
          Type '{ role: { contains: string; mode: string; }; }' is not assignable to type 'UserWhereInput'.
            Types of property 'role' are incompatible.
              Object literal may only specify known properties, and 'contains' does not exist in type 'EnumUserRoleFilter<"User">'.

message.text:
/fix Type '{ OR?: ({ name: { contains: string; mode: "insensitive"; }; } | { email: { contains: string; mode: "insensitive"; }; } | { phone: { contains: string; mode: "insensitive"; }; } | { role: { contains: string; mode: string; }; })[] | undefined; }' is not assignable to type 'UserWhereInput'.
  Types of property 'OR' are incompatible.
    Type '({ name: { contains: string; mode: "insensitive"; }; } | { email: { contains: string; mode: "insensitive"; }; } | { phone: { contains: string; mode: "insensitive"; }; } | { role: { contains: string; mode: string; }; })[] | undefined' is not assignable to type 'UserWhereInput[] | undefined'.
      Type '({ name: { contains: string; mode: "insensitive"; }; } | { email: { contains: string; mode: "insensitive"; }; } | { phone: { contains: string; mode: "insensitive"; }; } | { role: { contains: string; mode: string; }; })[]' is not assignable to type 'UserWhereInput[]'.
        Type '{ name: { contains: string; mode: "insensitive"; }; } | { email: { contains: string; mode: "insensitive"; }; } | { phone: { contains: string; mode: "insensitive"; }; } | { role: { contains: string; mode: string; }; }' is not assignable to type 'UserWhereInput'.
          Type '{ role: { contains: string; mode: string; }; }' is not assignable to type 'UserWhereInput'.
            Types of property 'role' are incompatible.
              Object literal may only specify known properties, and 'contains' does not exist in type 'EnumUserRoleFilter<"User">'.

response.value: The error occurs because the 'role' field is an enum and does not support the 'contains' filter; you should use 'equals' or 'in' for enum fields.

examples: Add a function that returns the sum of two numbers

slashCommands.name: tests
slashCommands.description: Generate unit tests for the selected code

disambiguation.description: Generate unit tests for the selected code. The user does not want to fix their existing tests.
examples: Write a set of detailed unit test functions for the code above.
